Legal_Issue: Whether the Canadian Human Rights Commission erred in dismissing the complaint of discrimination under sections 7 and 10 of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Application_Facts: Applicant alleged failure to accommodate her disability and a discriminatory policy against transfers by Canada Post Corporation
Decision_Outcome: The application for judicial review was dismissed; the Commission's decision was upheld
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Commission's decision
Court_Ruling: The Commission's decision was not patently unreasonable
Claimant_Status: Individual with a disability seeking accommodation and transfer within employment
Defendant_Behavior: Alleged failure to accommodate disability and refusal of transfer requests
Grounds_for_Claim: Discrimination based on disability in employment under sections 7 and 10 of the Act
Assessment_Factor: Timeliness of complaint, sufficiency of evidence, proper legal interpretation
Applicable_Legislation: Canadian Human Rights Act, sections 7 and 10
Procedural_Issue: Complaint dismissal due to lack of evidence and timeliness
Evidence_Used: Evidence submitted to the Canadian Human Rights Commission regarding accommodation and transfer requests
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections 7 and 10 of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Application_Basis: Failure to accommodate disability and discriminatory transfer policy
Evidence_Assessed: Commission assessed evidence and found it insufficient to support the claim
Relief_Sought: Overturning of the Commission's dismissal and recognition of discriminatory practices
Governing_Rule: Discrimination in employment based on disability is prohibited under the Canadian Human Rights Act
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of sufficient evidence to support the discrimination claim
Outcome: Judicial review dismissed; Commission's decision upheld
Harm_Assessment: Alleged harm due to lack of accommodation and denied transfers affecting employment rights
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed discrimination by Canada Post Corporation due to failure to accommodate her disability and refusal of transfer requests
Evidence_Handling: Commission reviewed evidence and determined it inadequate to proceed
Legal_Provision_Violated: Sections 7 and 10 of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Legal_Provision: Sections 7 and 10, Canadian Human Rights Act
Evidence_Assessment: Commission properly considered and assessed available evidence
Decision_Rationale: Decision was not patently unreasonable as the Commission applied the law correctly and evaluated the evidence
